column1: Kerosene is an oil used as a fuel for lamps, as well as heating and cooking.

Airways and lungs: - Breathing difficulty (from inhalation) - Throat swelling (may also cause breathing difficulty) Eyes, ears, nose, and throat: - Pain - Vision loss Gastrointestinal system: - Abdominal pain - Bloody stools - Burns of the esophagus (food pipe) - Vomiting, possibly with blood Heart and blood: - Collapse - Low blood pressure -- develops rapidly Nervous system: - Convulsions - Depression - Dizziness - Drowsiness - Euphoria ("drunk" feeling) - Headache - Loss of alertness (unconsciousness) - Seizures - Staggering - Weakness Skin: - Burns - Irritation
